Description: Fragment preserving large part of baluster of a pottery dinos stand, with black and red bands. Broken at top and at bottom.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Clay analysis places the piece in a group perhaps to be associated with Teos (B ass.), Schlotzhauer 2012, 85, where parallel stands are cited.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 228, no. 143)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 84-5, Nau 23, pl. 5f-g)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 119, pl. XXXVII, no. 336)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.861)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5709 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
